name: The HeadRush EP SR 000018
description:
Time for another lost gemm from the 90s,
The Headrush compilation was released in 1994
not on wax, only CD and K7
now available as a limited press on vinyl
New Jersey in the place
mastered from the original sources
get your copy before it's definitively gone
peace to all the artists involved that made this project happened
specially priced for 1 week starting now 
150 copies not to be repressed
shipping first week of december

snippets : http://soundcloud.com/carlstontigerhoodz/sets/the-headrush-ep-sr-000018

name: LPSD - Lyrical Prophets Strictly Dope EP
description:
LPSD aka Lyrical Prophets Strictly Dope are King D , Black Ran , Icy Lee and DJ Steven Flex are OG's from San Diego
At one point they were all over the map with the San Diego skateboard scene
The group is well-known by the underground hip-hop heads , especially their hit '' Back at Cha " featured on on the Beat Junkies’ first compilation/mixtape in 1997 (for which you can thank DJ Babu, who is apparently King D’s cousin)
their 1st 12" was only available as a limited test pressing/white label with the sought after b-side '' Insane Nigga " (Method Man sample on the hook)
Sergent records in collaboration with LPSD is proud to release these slept on underground gems from the 90's along with some dope new and unreleased tracks

150 copies  limited that will not be repressed

shipping date is beginning of  october

snippets : http://soundcloud.com/carlstontigerhoodz/sets/lpsd-lyrical-poets-so-dope-ep

name: The Rah Rah Gorilla # 1 : Gorilla's Approved Future Classics
description:
this time no throwback from the 90s, no blast from the past,but still sounding like the golden era boom bap
who said hip-hop was better back in the days ?
showcasing some of the best new and upcoming hip-hop artists from all over the planet from Europe to the US, here you can have a taste of what's the future of underground boom bap hip-hop.
future classics ? future legends ? or just hip-hop heads stuck in the past ?
some of the artists were only youngsters during the 90s, so they've take from their olders and add their own twist to this movement called Hip-Hop
amongst others they are activists of good music no matter they are from or going they do what they like : keeping the hip-hop spirit alive

they are authentic

200 copies limited pressing not to be repressed

shipping early august 

special thanx to all the artists involved in this project

snippets here : http://soundcloud.com/carlstontigerhoodz/sets/the-rah-rah-gorilla-1-on

name: Kukoo da Bag A Bonez Unreleased Demos EP 94-97
description:
Kukoo da Bag a Bonez is an underground legend, if you don't acknowlegde that it's that you've been living under a rock for like 20 years
he is responsible for a lot of underground hits during the famous hip-hop golden era 
from his classic " Real Kukoo ?" in collaboration with Mista Sinista from the X-Executioners add on top freestyles on the legendary Stretch Armstrong and Bobbito Show
to his more recent work , Kukoo always spits some real talk straight from the heart

“I feel like my music is a combination of street reality, dedication, struggle and creativeness, 
but at the same time a good feel and a vibe to party and have fun to”says Kukoo. 
He has concentrated from the start on developing his own style and it shows as word has spread about his ill flow and reputation for mad lyrical skills.

now here you go, fresh from some dusty D.A.Ts, more insane psycho home madness in collaboration with his long time partner in crime Mista Sinista who has produced
''You must Understand" and blessed another bangin track "Sleeping on the Enemy" with sharp cuts
100% unreleased from this creative period that was 94-97
history in the making

150 copies limited pressing

shipping last week of july - early august 

snippets here : http://soundcloud.com/carlstontigerhoodz/sets/kukoo-da-bag-a-bonez
